* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.



  





 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Robin Roos** 
 , Technology Practice Leader for the Northern Zone via:
 ***Tel: + 31 61422 8765 / Robin.Roos@chubb.com.***




 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Cybersecurity Product/Demand Manager
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
In this role, you will be
 **responsible for the product and demand management activities** 
**related to** 
**Cybersecurity solutions** 
 , addressing requirements by Telia units and common needs from Telia countries, discussing technical solutions and clarifying needed aspects with related technical teams. You will work in an Agile way, within the Compliance and Cybersecurity Core Capabilities Agile Release Train (in short C4-ART), together with a team of talented experts in IT, Networks, GSOC and other units. You will have the opportunity to
 **drive the cybersecurity solution demand** 
 toward Product Owners and Agile teams appointed to develop and deliver systems and technical solutions. These teams work within the ART (Agile Release Train), following Telia's way of working that adheres to the SAFe framework.
   

  

**As a Cybersecurity Product/Demand Manager…**
 You will be responsible for Cybersecurity products development, collecting requirements from the stakeholders, shaping and communicating solutions, interfacing with experts, architects, and engineers, designing and discussing solution architectures, refining the demand to identify dependencies, breaking down work tasks, documenting clearly the work and supporting the drive of Product Increment planning. The main tools utilized at Telia for Agile deliveries include Jira and Confluence, and knowledge of these tools is a plus.
   

  

 You will join an exciting multicultural team within the Data Mediation and Cybersecurity unit, which, within Tech IT, is responsible for the development and operations of the Data Mediation and Cybersecurity systems at Telia Company. These systems are utilized across all Telia countries and domains.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For…**
 You should have experience with the IT delivery lifecycle, including demand and requirements analysis and refinement, solution architecture design, delivery, and testing. You should be familiar with the main Cybersecurity tools such as
 **SIEM** 
 ,
 **EDR/endpoint security** 
 ,
 **Vulnerability Detection** 
 and
 **scanning, NDR** 
 ,
 **SOAR** 
 and related standards, protocols, system integration, APIs. Knowledge of security operations and related tools and use cases, including the main phases like
 **Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond** 
 , and
 **Recover,** 
 is essential. You should also be knowledgeable about the main regulatory frameworks for EU Telcos like
 **NIS2, DORA, GDPR,** 
 etc. Some experience with
 **asset management/CMDB** 
 and
 **IAM** 
 is preferred. Additionally, you should have knowledge of cybersecurity applied to IT, networks, and Telco networks.
   

  

 You should be skilled in Agile methodologies, SAFe PO/PM, requirement and feature collection and refinement, project management, stakeholder management, and communication. You should be a team worker with a good collaboration attitude in multicultural teams. Being result-oriented, with a clear and persistent approach to achieving results while managing complexity and challenges, is crucial. You should have an open and transparent attitude, an analytic approach, good communication and reporting skills, and the capability to collaborate with stakeholders across different units.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 21/04/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to Massimiliano Pianigiani at massimiliano.pianigiani@teliacompany.com or Linkedin.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Senior Databasutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Implementera och verifiera avidentifieringsmönster och funktioner för Oracle OEM Data Masking and Subsetting
* Utveckla funktioner med Oracle PL/SQL
* Utveckla skript (Unix shell) för automatisering av avidentifieringsprocessen
* Diverse uppgifter i Git och Jenkins
* Kontakter med leverantör (Oracle) när problem upptäcks i verktyget


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckla funktioner med Oracle PL/SQL.
* Minst 9 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Implementera och verifiera avidentifieringsmönster för Oracle OEM Data Masking and Subsetting.
* Minst 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet med Unix-/Linuxskriptning.
* Minst 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet med SQL Developer eller Toad.
* Minst 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet med SQL \*Plus eller regular expression-baserad maskning och utsökning.


**Meriterande**
* Arbetat på en stor myndighet, med minst 10 000 anställda med avidentifieringsmönster.
* Arbetat på en stor myndighet med att utveckla funktioner med Oracle PL/SQL.
* Arbetat med versionshantering i Git.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-04-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Strategic Account Executive SaaS (French speaker)
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**
 If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.
   

  

 At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.
   

  

 Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!
   

  

 Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.
   

  

**The Work You'll Do**
 Sovos is purpose built for modern regulatory environments – an evolving, complex landscape in which global authorities are requiring increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control of business processes, in many cases at the transaction level.
   

  

 Governments around the globe have embraced digitization to speed revenue collection, reduce fraud and close tax gaps. This is the catalyst for companies to move towards centralized compliance systems that can quickly scale to meet the demands of new and expanding mandates. Why do you care about this? Because compliance is not a nice to have, its increasingly becoming a MUST have. And Sovos offers industry's first and ONLY solution that unifies tax and regulatory reporting software in one platform. And you are the one selling it.
   

  

 The Strategic Account Executive will have the opportunity to work with a truly global team to provide a technology solution for critical needs and problems that our global customers and new prospects face. This role will directly manage the selling of the Sovos Tax Compliance Platform for assigned prospects and accounts. Our solutions help clients become and stay compliant around the world!
   

  

**More Specifically You Will**
* Generate new business opportunities for global strategic accounts (F100) while effectively managing internal enablement resources and working full sales cycle opportunities from initial contact, to close and up-sell/cross-sell
* Develop and execute an account-based commercial strategy to increase sales opportunities within existing key customers
* Deliver profitable new business revenue in order to meet and exceed revenue targets and relevant quotas
* Create and nurture executive and C-Suite relationships with existing clients and prospects
* Build a year-over-year record of consistent performance and accountability using MEDDPICC for qualification and managing complex and technical sales into large global enterprises
* Acquire and maintain in-depth knowledge of the tax compliance industry and the emerging competitive landscape
* Provide timely and accurate sales forecasts and reports to inform management’s strategic decision-making


**What We Need From You**
* Successful history of proven success selling SaaS-based platforms to large multi-national organizations through complex sales cycles, including selling different product lines to different business units
* Proven targeting, prospecting, and closing skills while achieving or exceeding revenue quotas for large multi country accounts
* Ability to present and speak knowledgably to the C-Suite level
* Employs a highly analytical approach to defining client outcomes and articulating value
* Ability to use facts and data to tell a value based story that leads to sales
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; paying attention to details
* Moderate (less than 50%) travel required; both domestic and international
* Fluency in French.


**What Does Sovos Offer You?**
 The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!
   

  

* Flexible Time-Off
* Uncapped Commission Plans
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognized Training and Development programs


 Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.
   

  

**Company Background**
 Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.
   

  

 More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Customer Trust and Experience Consultant
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and General Business
company_industry: Financial Services, Technology, Information and Internet, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**About Us**
 With over 85 million global active users and 2,5 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team - accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?
   

  

**Your Role**
**No matter where in Sweden you live, from busy cities to the quiet countryside, this opportunity is open to you!**
 Are you a Klarna user? Do you thrive on solving complex problems, shaping customer experiences, driving real change, passioned about interactions with customers?
   

  

 Join Klarna’s specialised Customer Trust & Experience team - where your insights don’t just help customers, they shape the future of our products and services. You are responsible for maintaining customer trust, handling technical and financial questions, and identifying areas for operational improvements. You work with Klarna’s success teams and identify opportunities to improve and set priorities.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Be the voice of Klarna, handling technical and financial queries with precision and care. Deliver exceptional customer experiences across phone, chat, and email.
* Identify trends and proactively feedback insights to improve our products and operations.
* Work cross-functionally with Klarna’s success teams to enhance customer experience and drive strategic improvements.
* Influence how we build trust, solve problems, and continuously elevate Klarna’s service.
* Work with Klarna’s leading AI tools and help refine them for an outstanding customer experience.


****What We Offer****
* 100% Flexibility: Choose your working hours and location from anywhere in Sweden.
* Competitive Compensation: Earn 400 SEK per hour with additional bonus incentives that may boost your overall pay up to 1000 SEK per hour.
* Empowerment and Impact: You have full autonomy to take ownership of your work and shape processes that make a real difference. Your ideas and contributions will drive meaningful change.


**Who You Are**
* A career professional with a background in operations, finance, business etc who is looking for a flexible opportunity or senior level student (year 2+ in uni) currently pursuing a degree in business, economics, law, political science or similar.
* Experienced customer service professional with a proven track-record of excellence is a great plus.
* Native Swedish speaker with business English proficiency.
* Based in Sweden with the right to work in the European Union.
* This is a freelance consultant role. You must be registered for F-skatt (Swedish tax status for self-employed) or be willing to obtain it in order to engage in this opportunity.
* Natural communicator with the innate ability to make complex ideas accessible to everyone.
* Problem solver, ready to confidently challenge the status quo and feedback Klarna’s routines and products.
* Customer obsessed advocate who will go the extra mile for every single consumer.
* Klarna user who likes our bold ideas, big ambitions, and ready to help reshape the future of fintech.
* A tech and AI curious individual.


**Hardware And Network Requirements**
 As this is a freelance role, you will need to provide your own work setup, including the following essential tools:
   

  

* A Windows laptop or desktop, less than 5 years old, with Windows 11 installed.
* A headset with a microphone.
* A minimum internet speed of 20 Mbit/s, with a reliable and stable connection to support video calls and collaboration tools.


 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005, Klarna has been on a mission to reimagine how consumers spend and save in their daily lives. We help people save time and money and reduce financial worry. With over 85 million global active users and 2.5 million transactions per day, our vision is a world where Klarna empowers everyone, everywhere, through seamless financial and commerce experiences—as a personalized, trusted assistant making financial empowerment effortless.
   

  

 Over 575,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store.

title: Professional Services Consultant - Nordics
description:
**Connect with Quadient**
 At Quadient, we support businesses of all sizes in their digital transformation and growth journey, unlocking operational efficiency with reliable, secure, and sustainable automation processes. Our success in delivering innovation and business growth is inspired by the connections our diverse teams create every day, with our clients and each other. It’s these connections that make Quadient such an exceptional place to grow your career, develop your skills and make a real impact – help our future-focused business lead the way in powering secure and sustainable business connections through digital and physical channels.
   

  

 Are you someone who likes to use your creativity and problem-solving skills to overcome technical challenges and provide best in class solutions to clients needs?
   

  

 Do you enjoy communicating and collaborating with both internal and external teams of technical and non-technical people, designing, presenting and demonstrating the value-add your solutions can bring?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Professional Services Consultant to join our team in Sweden. Read on for more information…
   

  

**Your role in our future**
 You will be an important member of our Professional Services team, dedicated to the success of customers’ virtualization strategies and their implementations. With your colleagues you will ensure that customers successfully implement Quadient’s solutions, and as a Professional Services Consultant, you will influence the success of each implementation, forming a vital link between the customer and Quadient.
   

  

 We’ve learned that if we put our thinking and efforts together, we’ll achieve better results for decisions big and small. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute at a high level because the way we see it, your input broadens our perspective as well as yours.
   

  

 You’ll engage with sales, pre-sales and project management, defining the services portion of our solution proposal, and you’ll meet with customers to clarify system specifications, gaining an understanding of their work practices and the nature of their business, in order to develop a solution to meet their needs.
   

  

 You will develop and implement agreed custom solutions, testing and installing custom software solutions, and you’ll present solutions in written or oral form, preparing documentation and presenting progress reports to customers while also working on, and organizing the delivery of projects.
   

  

 You’ll maintain integrity and professionalism when working with sensitive customer data and information, and you will also conduct training for users and other consultants, occasionally travelling to client sites.
   

  

**Your profile**
* You have proven experience in the development of custom solutions, you’ve potentially worked in a software development environment and you’re looking for a role that puts you in front of the customer.
* You’re able to demonstrate working knowledge or recent experience with scripting languages (Java), application development, databases and analytical tools and design functional specifications.
* You can quickly explore, examine and understand complex problems and how it relates to the customer’s business, and you can collaborate and listen with technical and non-technical consumers from IT administrators to executive level stakeholders.
* You’re well organized with a healthy sense of urgency, you’re able to set; communicate; and meet challenging deadlines with competing priorities.
* You can demonstrate your understanding of common enterprise applications and experience with both Windows and Unix operating systems; you’re comfortable on the command line interface.
* You enjoy the opportunity to travel, and you’re excited at the prospect of travelling mainly within the Sweden/Nordics region.
* You are a great communicator, you can deliver impact through adapting your style to your audience.


 Knowledge gaps can be filled. Even if you don’t satisfy every single requirement or meet every qualification listed, we still want to hear from you.
   

  

 Help shape the future of customer communications.
 **Apply now.**
**Rewards & Benefits**
**Flexible Work** 
 : Embrace a hybrid work model blending office and remote setup for a balanced lifestyle.
   

  

**Endless Learning:** 
 Access global opportunities for growth through our 24/7 online learning platform.
   

  

**Inclusive Community:** 
 Join diverse communities and engage in our Philanthropy program.
   

  

**Comprehensive Rewards:** 
 Enjoy competitive Total Rewards covering wellness, work/life balance, and more, including a generous referral scheme.
   

  

**Caring for Wellbeing** 
 : Access our complimentary employee assistance program for mental health support.
   

  

**Be yourself at Quadient**
 Our values define how we work as a team: Empowerment, Passion, Inspiration and Community. They inspire us to be EPIC. Together. What makes Quadient different is how different we are. We’re a team of individuals with one goal but many perspectives. When you connect with Quadient, you become part of a community that cares - in a culture that embraces differences and values every voice.
   

  

 We will consider any reasonable modifications to the interview process. If you require any assistance with the application process, please email us at careers@quadient.com
   

  

 Quadient is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*: We believe that diversity brings benefits to our customers, our business, and our people so we are committed to being an inclusive employer. We encourage applications from all suitable applicants, regardless of background. We firmly believe in zero discrimination in employment on any basis, including gender, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other protected characteristics.
   

  

**People. Connected.**
**#REMOTE**

title: Solution Architect - 3DEXPERIENCE
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Research Services
description:
As a Solution Architect within our Nordics services organization, your primary responsibility will be the design and architecting of technical solutions for clients based on customer analysis of the current ways of working.
   

  

 Dassault Systèmes, the 3DEXPERIENCE Company, provides businesses and people with virtual universes to imagine sustainable innovations. Our 3DEXPERIENCE platform leverages the Company’s world-leading 3D software applications to transform the way products are designed, produced, and supported. With its online architecture, the 3DEXPERIENCE environment helps businesses to test and evaluate — anywhere in the development lifecycle of a product or service — the eventual experience they will deliver to their customers. In short, 3DEXPERIENCE powers the next-generation capabilities that drive today’s Experience Economy.
   

  

**Role Description & Responsibilities**
* Define and propose a transformation path toward an integrated global solution, enabling the customer to achieve business objectives leveraging 3DS know-how and technologies powered by the 3DEXPERIENCE platform
* Coverage of the whole business processes with the expected business value while guaranteeing the final workability and relevancy of the solution specifically for manufacturing
* Create a solution that answers to the functional specification, scheduled delivery time, and proposed budget
* Work in areas related to ENOVIA, CATIA, DELMIA and integrations to handle different business scenarios
* Experience in BOM Management, Change Management, Variant Management, Classification, Process Engineering, integration with ERP, MES or other downstream systems etc
* Contribute with business consultant to capture customer business processes. Challenge customer business processes in regard to value creation and business transformation
* Assess customer opportunity in regards of feasibility, value and risks and deliver/support business and application consultant development of functional specifications to be implemented
* Leverage collaboration between 3DS organization around a common view of the solution architecture for project success and customer satisfaction
* Ensure the solution is proactively delivered through product implementation. Ensure to stick to out of the box solution implementation as much as possible and reduce unnecessary customizations


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Solution Architect, Industry Process Consultant, or similar role, with consulting experience in PLM projects
* Strong expertise in designing and architecting technical solutions using 3DEXPERIENCE Software along with either ENOVIA, CATIA or DELMIA
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically and analytically combined with excellent communication and presentation skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Good knowledge of industry standards & business processes
* Proficient in English and Swedish language


**What’s In It For You**
* An international and diverse working environment in a collaborative team
* Flexible working hours with hybrid working model, a good work-life balance and comprehensive benefits package
* Extensive skills and career development programs to build your journey with us


 Interested? Click on "Apply" to upload your application documents.
   

  

**Diversity statement**
 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: Affiliate Manager - Norway
description:
Addrevenue is an affiliate marketing platform, based in Sweden but with the World as our marketplace. Since our foundation in 2022, we have sought to attract the best possible talent to join us on our ambitious journey. And now we’re looking to expand the team even further.
 



  





 As an Affiliate Manager at Addrevenue, you are the crucial link between the advertisers and their affiliate partners, ensuring a smooth and mutually beneficial relationship. Our model is very simple, the advertisers on our platform only pay for actual sales. In other words, it is crucial for us to deliver and make sure our advertisers get results, it's only then that we as a company get paid. That's where you come in.
 



  





 We are now looking for a new star to join the team, with responsibility for the Norwegian market. You speak and write fluently in English and Norwegian. We also believe that you're based in Stockholm, Sweden, or willing to re-locate for the position.
 



  





 💡 Your skills
 



 In order to perform the tasks of an Affiliate Manager up to the high standards we set, we believe that you possess the following skillset:
 


* Excellent Communication Skills: Clear and concise communication skills are essential for building relationships, conveying trust, providing guidance, and resolving conflicts.
* Analytical Abilities: You can identify trends, optimize campaigns, and make informed decisions based on performance metrics.
* Creativity: You are able to suggest compelling promotional strategies that benefit both advertiser and affiliate
* Negotiation and Influencing: You are confident in negotiating agreements, persuading potential affiliates, and advocating for an advertiser’s interests.
* Tech Savviness: A natural understanding of reporting tools is crucial for managing and optimizing affiliate campaigns efficiently.



  





 💼 Job to be done
 



 As with most roles, activities can vary so there isn’t necessarily a ‘typical day’. However, most Affiliate Managers in our company will have several responsibilities, such as;
 


* Recruiting new advertisers to join the platform
* Recruiting and training new affiliates to maximize the quality and quantity of their referral traffic
* Overseeing the day-to-day management of affiliate campaigns to ensure maximum ROI is achieved
* Initiating new campaign ideas, including incentivization and bonuses for the programs
* Developing affiliate marketing strategies that deliver specified sales volumes
* Analyzing program and campaign activity to identify opportunities for improvement
* Delivering affiliate marketing reports to advertisers and senior management
* Ensuring that commissions and invoices are paid in a timely and accurate manner



  





 🚀 Application
 



 If you believe you have what it takes, you apply by sending an email with your CV to info@addrevenue.io or connect with Heimar on LinkedIn and tell us why you'd be the right person for the job.
 



  





 Recruiting manager
 



 Heimar Svensson, CEO

title: M&A Manager
description:
Dometic is a global market leader in the mobile living industry. Millions of people around the world use Dometic products in outdoor, residential, and professional applications. We are on a growth journey – now looking for our next star – a driven and analytical M&A Manager to our HQ in Solna Strand.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As M&A Manager you will play an important role in Dometic’s transformation journey by driving acquisition and divestment projects. The M&A manager will lead and co-ordinate both internal and external resources with the support from Head of M&A, to whom the position reports. Further, the M&A manager will work to ensure best practices are being defined and implemented, both for acquisitions and carve-outs/divesture. The M&A Manager will contribute to the strategic work of the group by performing analyses and develop sharp and well-structured presentation materials for evaluation and decision-making.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Project management of M&A and carve-out processes, with support from Head of M&A – including hands-on project co-ordination and leadership of the different workstreams in an M&A process, from start to finish.
* Support the Dometic group with financial and commercial analysis and evaluation of its business operations, markets, competitors and various strategic options.
* Support business segments with strategic planning and execution, by searching for acquisition targets and analyzing its potential strategic, commercial, financial, organizational and cultural fit.
* Perform financial modelling and valuation analysis of acquisition targets and divesture candidates.
* Support the M&A function in the continued development of best-in-class tools and templates being used for research, valuation, due diligence, carve-out and project management.


**What do we offer?**
 As M&A Manager at Dometic, you will be offered a great opportunity to both broaden and deepen your knowledge within M&A. You will have significant interactions with different parts of the organization, including the CEO and the CFO as well as Segment Presidents. You will deepen your understanding of the M&A process but also gain great understanding of general business drivers as well as a broad range of operational topics. You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow, evolve with the company and take on new challenges.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**A suitable background would be a** 
 at least 3 years of hands-on M&A experience within financial advisory at a bank, transaction service team or experience from a top tier management consultant firm – as well as the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

* BSc or MSc in Finance, Economics, Business or Industrial Engineering.
* Strategic Project management experience
* Ideally experience of both divestures (preferable corporate carve-outs) and acquisitions
* Fluent in English – proficient in both verbal and written communication.


**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:**
* Positive attitude – you demonstrate curiosity and a strong eagerness to learn.
* Good communication skills – you skillfully express ideas and information, both verbally and in writing.
* Strong relationship-building skills – you confidently engage with colleagues at all levels across the organization.
* Diligent with strong attention to detail – you ensure accuracy and thoroughness in your work.
* Strong numerical skills – you are skilled at and comfortable in working with numbers and data.
* Strong business acumen and a good understanding of financial markets
* Well developed commercial understanding and strategic thinking.
* Driven and motivated – you ensure progress and keep things moving forward.
* Finally, you are a person who naturally bring a positive vibe – your energy and enthusiasm rubs off!


**Dometic's Core Values**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of our core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
   

  

 Dometic operates with a 4+1 policy, 4 days per week in the office and the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
   

  

**Are you our next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Anna Allert, Talent Acquisition at anna.allert@dometic.com
   

  

 In this recruitment both personality and logical tests will be used as well as background check on final candidate, as part of the process.

title: Business Excellence Specialist
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**JOB SUMMARY** 
*:*
 We are looking for an individual who is driven, structured and wishes to be part of our growth journey. You'll manage governance and frameworks to ensure structure and compliance, as well as supporting the business with efficiency and scalability. As the company is on a growth journey, you will lead initiatives to develop your area and set new standards. To ensure organizational goals are met, you'll be collaborating with stakeholders across the company, and you'll need to have effective follow-ups and be able to implement initiatives.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Governance & Frameworks: Develop and maintain governance structures and frameworks to ensure compliance and alignment with organizational goals
* Policy Management: Own and sustain the policy management framework and process; oversee the creation, implementation, and review of company policies to ensure they are up-to-date and effective; ensure implementation through communication and training.
* Risk Management: Own and sustain the risk management framework and process; lead risk reviews; prepare reports and presentations; ensure a proactive approach to risk management.
* Business Cycle Support: Support the business cycle with e.g. scorecard tracking and reporting.
* Project Management: Lead and manage projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Additional Duties: Perform various other duties as assigned.


**Minimum Qualification:**
 EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
   

  

* Academic degree in business, engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in governance, policy management, risk management, or a similar role.
* Understanding of business operations and organizational structures.
* Experience working with different departments and managing cross-functional projects.
* Experience in an international context.
* Proficient in English.


 OTHER SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS:
   

  

**Drive, proactivity & ownership**
* Result-driven with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
* Proactively identifies needs and sets clear plans for execution.


**Analytical & structured**
* Systematic approach to work, creating structure for others.
* Analytical skills with the ability to see the big picture and provide relevant information for decision-making.
* Problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


**Communication Skills & Integrity**
* Effective communicator across different levels and parts of the organization.
* Confident in presenting and defending own point of view.


**Leadership**
* Ability to gain trust and manage stakeholders effectively.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Experienced advisor | Global Compliance Services
description:
Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Do you have a solid understanding of, and a passion for, creating value through accounting and financial reporting? Would you love to work in a community of solvers together with some of Sweden's top advisors and specialists? Come and join us at PwC!
   

  

**Become a part of PwC's Financial Reporting's Global Compliance Service**
 We are looking for an experienced advisor to join our team of Financial Reporting’s Global Compliance Services (GCS) practice. The position is a role as an engagement manager within our group that specialises in supporting global clients with their Swedish subsidiaries’ statutory accounting obligations (including their annual reports). Acting as an engagement manager means being responsible for supporting the engagement members and reviewing their work.
   

  

 The GCS practice blends our combination of practical and technical subject matter expertise in preparing statutory Swedish financial statements for our clients. We also help with Group to Swedish GAAP reconciliations as well as proactively supporting throughout our clients’ audit processes. Our multinational clients range from global leaders to mid-tier and smaller groups across a wide range of industry sectors.
   

  

***In your role as engagement manager, your primary responsibilities will include:***
  

  

* Up-front scoping and engagement planning
* Ensure engagement compliance with PwC risk management policies
* Reviewing Swedish statutory reports (including data collection) and GAAP analyses in order to ensure compliance with local laws/regulations
* Having frequent interaction and coordinate with clients and the PwC network
* Identifying opportunities to further support our clients with related PwC services and helping clients to manage their accounting risks
* Organising, monitoring and managing projects to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery
* Work with leadership on:
+ Overall project statuses
+ Budget compliance/management
+ Participating in proposals for potential new clients


 ,
   

  

***Your profile***
 We’re looking for someone who has hands-on experience from accounting and Swedish financial reporting (both K3 and K2), as well as understanding of finance reporting processes. You are able to plan, execute and prioritise projects where the scope of the project and time plan may change several times. You have high social skills and appreciate a role where international relationship building and trust are central.
   

  

***To succeed in this role, we expect you to have:***
* Bachelor’s degree in Economics
* Proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish
* Approx. 4-5 year previous experience from hands-on working with Swedish GAAP
* Experience of preparing and/or reviewing financial reports in accordance with Swedish GAAP
* Demonstrated ability to drive and coordinate projects
* Great skills of Microsoft Excel


**It’s An Advantage If You Have** 
  

  

* Previous experience from working on a larger international accounting firm
* Previous experience from working in an international network setting (e.g. to work across borders and cultures)
* Previous experience from working with IFRS and/or US GAAP
* Great skills in:
+ G Suite and/or MS Office
+ Capego


**It Is a Significant Advantage If You Have**
* Previous experience from working with financial reporting outsourcing projects for international clients
* Previous experience working within the Financial Reporting module of Workiva


**What We Offer You**
 A career in Financial Reporting’s GCS practice will provide you with the opportunity to, together with some of Sweden's top advisors and specialists, deliver value to clients by supporting their accounting function and helping them solve practical problems. PwC's unique offering to our clients is that we function as a one-stop shop, bringing e.g. accounting, financial reporting, compliance, valuation and tax expertise to the table in one go.
   

  

**Does it all sound good to you? We’re looking forward to your application!**
**Please Submit a Complete Application Including**
* CV
* Cover letter where you describe what motivates you in this field


 Your application can be written in either Swedish or English. Since we are continuously reviewing the applications please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.
   

  

 Do you have any questions regarding this position please contact Kajsa Elgmo, kajsa.elgmo@pwc.com. Do you have any questions regarding the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter down below.
   

  

**Recruitment process** 
*We believe in the strength of having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection.*
*We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview.*

title: Finance Controller (ALLEX Graduate Program)
description:
Nordic Infucare started its journey as an entrepreneurial company with the desire to do things differently. Mats Bergryd founded the business to offer specialized treatments in a home environment, serving patients who suffer from chronic disease. He chose that niche as he, after 20 years in the industry, had identified a gap between what was possible to achieve with smart technology and pharmaceuticals, and the actual result. Mats concluded that there was an opportunity to increase the quality of life or patients with chronic disease by closing the gap, and that it would be good business for the one who succeeded.
   

  

 Since the start in 2002 we have grown into a company with more than 100 employees. Today we are a part of the Air Liquide group, but the patient’s quality of life still guides all our actions.
   

  

 Creative problem solvers
   

  

 Something we all have in common at Nordic Infucare is that we like solving problems and that we are motivated by making a difference for the patients. There is no doubt in our minds that we harness the most of our employees’ creativity and top performances when we don’t lock them into processes but set them free to find their own solutions.
   

  

**How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?**
 Nordic Infucare, part of the Air Liquide Group, is seeking an ambitious Graduate Controller to join our dynamic team and become a key financial partner to the business. This is a great opportunity to develop skills in financial analysis, reporting, and forecasting, while gaining invaluable experience in a multinational environment as an ALLEX ( Air Liquide Leading EXcellence Program) Graduate.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the CFO, and working closely with the Finance Manager you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Producing accurate monthly financial reports and analyse quarterly variances for both Nordic Infucare and the Air Liquide Group
* Analysing Nordic Infucare's financial performance, identifying trends, and recommending strategic solutions to management
* Collaborating with stakeholders to achieve financial targets by providing detailed performance analysis and actionable insights that support key business decisions
* Contributing to the development and implementation of the company's strategic financial plan.
* Developing and maintaining Finance Power BI dashboards, creating key performance indicators (KPIs) and reports to enhance financial visibility
* Contributing to diverse finance and strategy projects, gaining broad business experience
* Providing ad-hoc financial analysis and support to the Chief Financial Officer as and when needed.


**Are you a MATCH?**
 To be eligible for the ALLEX program, you must have a relevant Bachelors or Masters Degree, and no more than 36 months of post grad work experience.
   

  

 You will also need:
   

  

* A degree in Accounting, Business, Economics, Finance or a related field
* Practical experience in controlling and financial reporting, gained through internships or postgraduate roles (within the 36- month limit)
* Excellent communication skills with a structured, proactive way of working
* Fluency in English (essential); proficiency in any Nordic language (preferred)
* Strong business acumen and a customer/ patient mindset
* To be dynamic, curious, ambitious & enthusiastic


**About The ALLEX Program**
 The Air Liquide Leading EXcellence Program (ALLEX) Program is Air Liquide's international graduate program for talented and ambitious fresh graduates from all over Europe.
   

  

 By participating in this program, you will have the opportunity to kick start your career by making an important contribution to your team and developing your skills on a professional and personal level.
   

  

 As an ALLEX participant you will:
   

  

* Hold a permanent position with responsibilities with Nordic Infucare
* Develop yourself through two international assignments within Europe (3 months each) over a 3 years period of time. You will discover other business areas, activities, country and working environment of Air Liquide.
* Benefit from an international network: through physical and virtual events, development programs and mentoring


**Our Differences make our Performance**
 At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.
   

  

 We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.

title: General Counsel
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As General Counsel, you will be the cornerstone of our legal framework, driving internal processes, compliance, governance, and strategic decision-making. Reporting directly to the CFO, you’ll navigate the complexities of a public company while enabling scalability for our global ambitions. You will be leading a team of three legal counsels specializing in different areas (e.g. commercial and data privacy).
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* SaaS Legal Expertise
* Manage legal processes, from internal reviews to external partnerships, tailored for the SaaS landscape.
* Oversee customer and vendor contracts, including public-facing terms and conditions.
* Corporate Governance
* Lead corporate governance processes, including policy development and compliance with Euroclear requirements.
* Manage Annual and Extraordinary General Meetings, adhering to listed public company regulations.Compliance and Risk Management
* Ensure compliance within our product and services, addressing legal queries on features, user authentication, and data privacy (e.g., cookie banners, GDPR).
* Own internal control and risk management frameworks, including committee involvement (Risk Committee, Enterprise Forum).
* Incentive Programs, Share transactions and Shareholder Communication
* Design and manage cross-border incentive programs and cap tables.
* Handle shareholder relations and board documentation, including inaugural meetings and incentive program allocations.
* Manage legal side of share transactions
* Lead legal workstreams in projects related to raising capital (if deemed needed)
* Intellectual Property
* Safeguard our intellectual property, including brand assets and potential patents.
* Employment Law
* Work closely with the People & Culture department in employment law related matters (which is owned by People & Culture)
* Oversee employment-related legal matters and contract templates.
* Scalability and Efficiency
* Develop scalable legal operations, ensuring processes align with business growth.
* Build for the long term


**Professional Experience And Qualifications**
* Law degree with 10+ years of experience in corporate law
* Experience from working in a B2B SaaS company
* Strong leadership skills, experience from leading a team, preferably in a high-growth or tech environment
* English is our corporate language so a high level of English proficiency is required


**A Bonus If You Have Experience Within**
* Public company governance, including Euroclear-registered entities
* M&A


**Personal Characteristics**
* High degree of self-leadership with a collaborative mindset.
* Thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a proactive, solution-driven approach.
* A passion for working with the “best legal team in the world!”


**The Recruitment Process**
* Introduction Interview
* Personality & Logical ability assessment test
* Competence Interview
* Culture & Leadership Interview
* References
* Offer


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior Underwriter Professional Indemnity (PI), Nordics
description:
AIG söker just nu efter en Senior PI Underwriter till vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Du kommer att rapportera direkt till vår nordiska Cyber & PI chef och vara en del av ett större lokalt och Nordiskt Financial Lines team.
   

  

**Teamet**
 Du kommer att ingå i ett större lokalt och Nordiskt Financial Lines team med både erfarna och juniora underwriters baserade på våra kontor runt om i Norden. Det nordiska teamet arbetar med produkter så som Crime, K&R, Cyber, VD-och Styrelseansvar, Professional Indemnity osv. och arbetar tätt tillsammans med våra nordiska och lokala UW operations team, lokala distributionsteam samt vårt kommersiella skadeteam.
   

  

**Urval av arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen kommer du att agera som senior underwriter med fokus mot PI (professional indemnity) och arbeta primärt mot internationella kunder baserade i Norden. Du kommer att leda våra key PI konton, fronta AIG mot mäklare och kunder och vara med på resan att bygga upp ett nordiskt Cyber och PI team. Rollen kommer även innebära att stötta mer juniora UWs i deras utveckling.
   

  

**För att söka tjänsten**
 Vi ser gärna att du har några års erfarenhet inom underwriting samt erfarenhet inom PI. I korthet så ser vi att:
   

  

  

* Du har några års erfarenhet från underwriting
* Erfarenhet inom PI
* Utöver ovan, några års erfarenhet inom försäkringsbranschen, då som t ex mäklare, skadereglerare eller liknande.
* Du behärskar engelska samt ett nordiskt språk i talk och skrift.


 Meriterande är om du har:
   

  

  

* Universitetsutbildning inom juridik, ekonomi eller liknande.
* Ytterligare språk


**Intresserad?**
 Om du har några frågor kring positionen är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

  

* Chris Valentin, Nordic Head of Financial Lines, +45 91 32 51 12


 Sänd gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt via vår karriärportal, dock senast den 24 februari.
   

  

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
   

  

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**
 We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
   

  

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*
 AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
   

  

 Functional Area:
   

  

 UW - Underwriting
   

  

 AIG Europe S.A Filial i Sverige

title: Head of Accounting till börsnoterat bolag
description:
*Är du en trygg och erfaren ledare med en stark grund i redovisning? Trivs du i en roll där du får påverka, driva förändringsarbete och arbeta i en konsultverksamhet i en noterad miljö? Då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning.* 




  





 Rollen innebär att du leder redovisningsteamet, bestående av fyra medarbetare, och rapporterar direkt till CFO. Som Head of Accounting får du möjlighet att utveckla och förbättra våra processer för finansiell rapportering och bokslut. Du ansvarar för hela koncernredovisningen och förväntas ha bred erfarenhet av alla delar inom redovisning i en börsnoterad miljö.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 




 - Säkerställa korrekta och tidsenliga månads-, kvartals- och årsbokslut inklusive konsolidering samt hög kvalitet i den externa och interna rapporteringen till börsen och andra intressenter
 



 - Upprätta och sammanställa koncernens årsredovisningar enligt IFRS
 



 - Genomföra finansiell analys och rapportering på koncernnivå
 



 - Utveckla och implementera ekonomiska processer, policys och riktlinjer
 



 - Stötta dotterbolag i redovisnings- och ekonomifrågor
 



 - Övergripande ansvar för efterlevnad och regelverk kopplat till redovisning, moms och skatt
 



 - Driva och initiera förbättrings- och effektiviseringsprojekt inom redovisningsrelaterade frågor
 



 - Ansvara för koncernens cashpool, skattefrågor och skatteberäkningar
 



 - Leda och ansvara för den dagliga driften av redovisningsavdelningen
 



 - Handha vanligt förekommande personalrelaterade uppgifter så som genomförande av regelbundna medarbetarsamtal, upprätthållande av utvecklingsplaner, lönesättning och godkännande av tidrapporter.
 



  





**Din erfarenhet** 




 - Akademisk examen inom ekonomi, finans eller motsvarande
 



 - Har erfarenhet av koncernredovisning och är van vid kvartalsbokslut, årsredovisningar, IFRS och andra förekommande uppgifter inom en börsnoterad koncern
 



 - Har arbetat som ledare och har förmågan och erfarenheten av att coacha och motivera teammedlemmar
 



 - Har goda kunskaper i Excel
 



 - Har utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
 



 - Meriterande med bakgrund inom revision, jobbat inom it-konsultbolag
 



 - Erfarenhet av förvärv är en fördel
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi ser att du har tidigare erfarenhet av en roll som Head of Accounting/Finance Manager/Redovisningschef med personalansvar samt en gedigen förståelse för IFRS och gärna konsultverksamhet. Du är van vid att arbeta med finansiell rapportering och har en övergripande förståelse för koncernredovisning.
 



 Du är en trygg och lugn ledare med ett stort intresse för att utveckla både människor och processer. Du har en analytisk och lösningsorienterad inställning samt en prestigelös attityd. Vidare trivs du i en föränderlig miljö där du får möjlighet att påverka och göra skillnad.
 



 Du är strukturerad och målinriktad och en omtänksam ledare som gör sitt bästa att stötta sitt team. Vi ser att du är proaktiv och inte rädd för att ifrågasätta processer samt gillar att driva förändring.

title: Nordic Head of Casualty
description:
Nordic Head of Casualty UW
   

  

 AIG Nordic is currently looking for a Nordic Head of Casualty Underwriting, with preferred location to be at our office in Stockholm. It’s an exciting role and where the successful candidate will be managing and supporting the full Nordic Casualty team in achieving its key business targets and strongly contribute to the EMEA Casualty team long term strategy.
   

  

 The role has dual reporting lines and will report into both our Head of Casualty EMEA and to our Nordic General Manager and be an important member of our Nordic leadership team.
   

  

 Business Management
   

  

  

* Leadership of the Nordic UW Casualty team, the development of business strategies (within our EMEA General Insurance parameters) as well as the annual financial targets
* Monitoring and managing multiple distribution channels, partnerships and brokers
* Ensuring successful execution of product development, underwriting
* Measuring and reporting on operational issues, opportunities and development plans against company objectives
* Driving continuous operational improvement projects


 External Relationship Management
   

  

  

* Representing AIG to major clients and brokers across Nordics
* Expand and enhance the AIG Casualty brand
* Managing internal and external stakeholder relationships across the 4-5 countries


 People Management
   

  

  

* Lead and manage the Nordic casualty team (12 HCs) located across the Nordic countries
* Communicating the AIG vision, mission, and overall General Insurance direction
* Serve as a member of the Nordics Senior Leadership Team


 What we’re looking for:
   

  

 Leadership Skills:
   

  

  

* A UW track record of financial and operational success in casualty having delivered profitable growth in the destined region
* A “natural” with clients who can represent AIG effectively and support the introduction, establishment and growth of valuable client relationships across Nordic market
* Experienced people leader; a relationship developer and team builder; a strong focus on talent and leadership development; someone who attracts and develops high-caliber talent and who builds diverse, high-performing teams
* 
* Proven ability to manage a broad range of stakeholders
* 
* Highly collaborative approach across functions and countries
* 
* Ability to manage and influence in a matrix structure and across a wide geography


 Technical Skills and Expertise:
   

  

  

* Significant Casualty industry experience, stature, and credibility in one or more product lines
* Several years’ experience in people management
* A leader who develops a bold vision and distinct strategies that result in competitive advantage
* Very good communication & interpersonal skills - fluency in written and spoken English as well as a Nordic language


 Core Competencies:
   

  

  

* Drive for profitable results
* Strategic leadership
* Collaborate and influence
* Ability to execute in a matrix structure


 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact;
   

  

  

* Fredrik Forsström, Nordic General Manager, +46 704 19 40 81, fredrik.forsstrom@aig.com.
* Alexander Sjöberg, Nordic Head of HR - +46 (0)70 913 73 88, alexander.sjoberg@aig.com


 AIG Nordic
   

  

 An interesting position in a dynamic environment where you will be part of a brilliant Nordic & European organization. AIG Nordic has offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo and Helsinki. As a region, we work closely together and where we possess expertise in many different areas across the cluster.
   

  

**About AIG**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a world leader in insurance and financial services, leading international insurance organization with operations in more than 100 countries and jurisdictions. AIG's common stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, as well as the stock exchanges in Ireland and Tokyo.
   

  

 AIG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Read more at www.aig.com
   

  

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
   

  

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**
 We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
   

  

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*
 AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
   

  

 Functional Area:
   

  

 UW - Underwriting
